title: 6 of the last 10 champions have knockups/displacements

replies.body: If Ivern's ult, Daisy auto's you three times you get knocked up too. Why isnt he here
Also Camille pushes her target back with the rope-jump.

Whoops, almost forgot Ivern exists, I'll fix that asap.

Thanks!

Ornn has 4 knockups/displacements.

Q: Pillar spawn is a displacement/knockup (triggers Courage)
W: Brittle'd Autos are displacements, triggers Courage (not sure if it counts as airborne)
E: Impact aoe knockup, definitely airborne, triggers Courage.
R: Second pass ult is aoe knockup, airborne and triggers Courage.

Well, I could count Camille too then since her E briefly displaces people hit. I was talking about actual knockups that lock you down for ages if you get hit.
I'm honestly fine with Ornn having CC, he's a tank and it's all he provides for his team. But other champions are loaded with knockups for no real reason.

If that is your argument, then I don't understand why you listed Kled as having knock ups.
He basically needs these CCs to be displacements, because they are already **really** short in duration and if they could get reduced by tenacity, then having this CC would be basically pointless.

I don't think his Q displacement is... short. I think it's very powerful if he manages to stay in range. 
I just made a list of champions released with displacements, I am not saying "hey Kled should not have one!!!" because I can agree with some of those knockups... But let's be real, they've released more knockups than actual stuns in the last 2 years.

It is a 100 unit displacement and the duration of the actual hard CC is really short.
https://youtu.be/uW2linaaqRI
Look at that video, pay attention how long Sion is actually not able to move.
The displacement is short, that doesn't mean I am saying that it is a weak ability.

It deals a good chunk of damage if you build some AD and slows after the displacement, so you are able to stick to your enemy.
But the hard CC is really not lasting long, mostly it is for interrupting enemies and some sticking power.

Have to agree that we got alot of displacements and knock ups, though.
The upside is that a CC, which can't be altered in duration, is earier to balance in my opinion.

You'd be surprised what is considered a popup. 
I've seen yasuo ult off of people knocked back from trundles pillar, likewise you loose total control during that split second; so yeah displacements count. 
I concur that there should be some counterplay to this crippling cc, since riot won't lower the mobility.
I've seen Yasuo ult off blast cone so... Not even talking about how is ult synergizes with everything rn lol
I agree displacements are too prevalent, but considering they're the most reliable for interrupting mobility . . . Now if only we had some counterplay to vulnerability denials, lol.

Actually a small knock up or displacement is still powerful since it can stop dashes

This is part of why Thresh E is so powerful because of the AoE and it being pretty instant it is quit easy for Thresh to prevent enemies from dashing past him

> Well, I could count Camille too then since her E briefly displaces people hit. I was talking about actual knockups that lock you down for ages if you get hit.

Then why did you list Kled?

Now that I think about it, a lot of champions released in the last few years have some kind of knockup. Looking further back than the OP's list, we've got:

{{champion:421}} knockup on W

{{champion:429}} knockup on ult

{{champion:161}} knockup on E

{{champion:201}} knockup on ult

{{champion:268}} knockup on ult

{{champion:157}} knockups everywhere

This isn't even considering the champions who gained knockups by being reworked: {{champion:3}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:83}} (technically his W can displace you, much like Trundle's pillar, if you're right on top of it when it spawns, but I admit this one is stretching things a bit).

Add all these to the list of champions who already had knockups of some kind in their kit and that's a hell of a lot of cc that you simply can't do anything about. It would be one thing if Tenacity reduced knockup duration, but for some reason Riot doesn't want to do that.
Azir also had a knockup on his E when he was released.
{{champion:154}}  Q rework, more displacement.

If we count class updates, we also have {{champion:57}} who got a bigger knockback on his Q, and the absolute mess that was {{champion:154}} who has like... 3 multi-target displacements? 
I think that half of the problem with reworked Zac is that if he manages to jump on you there's basically nothing you can do, simply because you can't cleanse/reduce ANY of his CCs.
The more champions that get released with huge mobility and huge damage to compliment it, the more ways/ options there needs to be to lock them down in game

Immobile champions are supposed to be susceptible to CC. Especially considering it's immobile champions who dominate the game right now. And when we move to a mobility meta, the CC will be just as appreciated
I don't see immobile champions dominate the game except for Kog or Twitch, and you're not going to CC them anyway because they'll melt you before you can even try lol
Knock Ups aren't the correct form of punishing mobility. It punishes the champion who want to buy Tenacity like Tanks and Fighters.

Except almost all the recent knock ups are so short or situational, even having them be affected by tenacity wouldn't matter.

The only significant ones on OP's list are Taliyah, Rakan, Kayn and Ornn.

The first two's primary power in their kit is tied in with their W, Kayn requires going into Rhaast and Ornn is this year's Nautilius, plus he was garbage even with all that displacable CC.

Well yeah but other forms of CC are still pretty popular. For instance:
Jhin has Root+Slows
ASol has Stun
Taliyah has slows
Kled only has his 2 small displacements
Ivern has a Root, a Knockup, and i THINK a slow (Dont remember but doesnt his range autos slow?)
Camille has a tiny displacement+slow+Does her ult count as CC?
Xayah has a Root
Rakan has a charm
Kayn has a slow on W when NOT Rhaast
Ornn is disruption incarnate.

Taking into count reworks since WW we have:
WW has suppresion+fear
Galio has taunt+2 knockups (And his passive MIGHT slow dont remember)
Evelynn has a charm.

So i agree Displacements are pretty popular RN, but if you DONT count the tiny displacements like Camille/Kled/ASol. Knockups are just another form of CC that is used when every champion has AT LEAST 1.

Here is a way to avoid Taliyah's knockback.
- get boots

Yea, Taliyah's W is super easy to dodge unless you're slowed/creep blocked.

Not talking about reliability here though. More about the fact that knockups are getting too popular.

You know the ironic thing? None of these champs are currently problematic. :D

Maybe your just being a tad over dramatic about this. I mean, {{champion:516}} has the most displacements/knockups of all of them and he's kinda shit tier.

I agree with the sentiment, but not with the form of your argument. Like, sure, Camille and Kled are technically knock-up, but it's so short that it would be useless if you could reduce it any more, and it's not the kind of things that can lead to uncleansable chain-CCs. The stun on Camille after the knock-back, and the heavy slow on Kled after the pull are much more important, and THAT can be cleansed. Just an example, same thing is true for a lot of champs in your list.

Where I'm annoyed is when ALL Ornn's CC are knock-up. Not a single stun, nothing that can be cleansed. Compared to a Nautilus or a Malphite or a Maokai, that's far too much knock-ups, and not enough other CCs like Roots or Stuns.

{{item:3070}} {{champion:89}} {{item:3070}} 
There was a Time when ***I*** was the end-all god of CC. . .
All hail for the true Bronze master {{champion:157}}
{{champion:136}} (ult), {{champion:163}} (W), and {{champion:164}} (ult) displacements are necessary for kit functionality. Theirs is justified.
Camille's E's displacement is pathetically small, as is Kled's R's displacement. It's essentially the knock back equivalent of Kassadin's Q - only good for interrupting channels and proccing Courage.

The issue is whether the Knock-ups are being added as a default CC (which is lazy), or they're doing it as an attempt to make Yasuo increasingly viable in more team-comps.

If you start from Yasuo's release, most of the Champions released/reworked have a Knock-up (Azir had a Knock-up on release but this was removed due to him being broken).

Seems very coincidental.

Weird conspiracy.

Yasuo thematically is already a very popular champion (loner, edgy, samurai) that isn't tough to sell skins for, and Yasuo is bad not because he doesn't have enough opportunities to use his ultimate.

Besides, Yasuo's ult only shines in large area knock ups, like Malphite and Wukong (old champions). Using it on Camille's .2 second displacement isn't gonna make him more viable.

Actually, fun trivia:

Knock-ups ignoring tenacity was originally a bug. Like Ward hopping (see old Kat, Jax, Lee), it was considered interesting enough to leave in the game.

The reason Riot Likes Knock-ups now is *because* they're immune to tenacity. Riot doesn't have to balance them under the assumption that they can be reduced.

Kinda funny, actually.

Don't forget that 4 of the last 7 also have a period when they are untargetable.
{{champion:141}} His ult
{{champion:498}} Her ult
{{champion:164}} Her ult
{{champion:240}} Being knocked off skarrl, which also de-aggros towers.

Before these champs only about 10~ had this fun and engaging gameplay mechanic.

And on another note, Jhin is the only champ out of the past 11, and the only one released
 after 2015 that has gotten a skin in addition to their release skin.

Ornn is a tank, most tanks have to have knock ups. The sub-par tanks like mundo have no cc. So that is understandable.

Also, Aurelion Sol is all about positioning and your ult is mostly saved has his only form of self peel. Also understandable.

The rest of those champs could have had kits that had gone even in a slightly different direction to avoid giving them knock ups/displacements. But I feel as though Ornn and Aurelion sol are justified.

A displacement I DO NOT feel is justified is thresh's initial Q. He displaces the target very briefly once its hit with Q incase you didnt know. Yasuo can even ult off of it. I dont feel this is necessary for a support that has so much outplay potential and is generall all around a solid support. Some may not agree, but I just dont feel like its necessary. Certainly not op.
{{champion:41}} don't worry, i'm k
Basically, make Tenacity reduce displacement.
I think knockups are important since they can interrupt dashes, but I think maybe we need a type of CC that can interrupt CC but also be reduced by tenacity.

It's part of their game design to give knockups to champions who need them on unreliable to land skills. The knockup duration goes up according to how hard it is to land (save some ultimates).

Knockbacks shouldn't even be considered in the same category. Knockbacks have very little actual CC time expect for some with stuns attached to them ({{champion:64}} oh how much I hate that it does, this one is even classified as a knockup because of it)
You're actually a season or two late to be mentioning this...

Knockups are very cool and thematic.  Get smacked by a lava ram?  Makes sense that you get knocked high into the air rather than simply stunned.

But the mechanic is busted as all heck.  I really think that Riot needs to rework the code to allow knockback distance/duration to be reduced by tenacity.
